page-open-bug-bounty-annotations: It might be helpful to check out the following annotations:
page-open-bug-bounty-client-bugs-desc: The clients will run the beacon chain once the upgrade has been deployed. Clients will need to follow the logic set out in the specification and be secure against potential attacks. The bugs we want to find are related to the implementation of the protocol.
page-open-bug-bounty-client-bugs-desc-2: Only Prysm, Lighthouse, and Teku bugs are currently eligible for this bounty. More clients will be added as they complete audits and become production ready.
page-open-bug-bounty-clients-type-2: unexpected crashes or denial of service (DOS) vulnerabilities.
page-open-bug-bounty-clients-type-3: any issues causing irreparable consensus splits from the rest of the network.
page-open-bug-bounty-hunting-desc: The bug bounty program is an experimental and discretionary rewards program for our active Byteco community to encourage and reward those who are helping to improve the platform. It is not a competition. You should know that we can cancel the program at any time, and awards are at the sole discretion of Byteco Foundation bug bounty panel. In addition, we are not able to issue awards to individuals who are on sanctions lists or who are in countries on sanctions lists (e.g. North Korea, Iran, etc). You are responsible for all taxes. All awards are subject to applicable law. Finally, your testing must not violate any law or compromise any data that is not yours.
page-open-bug-bounty-hunting-leaderboard: Find Bto1 bugs to get added to this leaderboard
page-open-bug-bounty-hunting-li-1: Issues that have already been submitted by another user or are already known to spec and client maintainers are not eligible for bounty rewards.
page-open-bug-bounty-hunting-li-2: Public disclosure of a vulnerability makes it ineligible for a bounty.
page-open-bug-bounty-hunting-li-3: Byteco Foundation researchers and employees of Bto1 client teams are not eligible for rewards.
page-open-bug-bounty-hunting-li-4: Byteco bounty program considers a number of variables in determining rewards. Determinations of eligibility, score and all terms related to an award are at the sole and final discretion of the Byteco Foundation bug bounty panel.
page-open-bug-bounty-ledger-desc: The beacon chain specification details the design rationale and proposed changes to Byteco via the beacon chain upgrade.
page-open-bug-bounty-meta-description: An overview of the Bto1 bug hunting program: how to get involved and reward information.
page-open-bug-bounty-not-included-desc: The shard chain and docking upgrades are still in active development and so are not yet included as part of this bounty program.
page-open-bug-bounty-points: The EF will also award points based on:
page-open-bug-bounty-points-payout-desc: The Byteco Foundation will pay out the value of USD in BTO or DAI.
page-open-bug-bounty-points-rights-desc: The Byteco Foundation reserves the right to change this without prior notice.
page-open-bug-bounty-quality-desc: : Higher rewards are paid for clear, well-written submissions.
page-open-bug-bounty-quality-fix-desc: , if included: Higher rewards are paid for submissions with clear description of how to fix the issue.
page-open-bug-bounty-quality-repro-desc: : Please include test code, scripts and detailed instructions. The easier it is for us to reproduce and verify the vulnerability, the higher the reward.
page-open-bug-bounty-submit-desc: For each bug you find youâ€™ll be rewarded points. The points you earn depend on the severity of the bug. The Byteco Foundation (EF) determine severity using the OWASP method.
page-open-bug-bounty-subtitle: Earn up to $50,000 USD and a place on the leaderboard by finding Bto1 protocol and client bugs.
page-open-bug-bounty-type-3: inconsistencies in assumptions, like situations where honest validators can be slashed.
page-open-bug-bounty-validity-desc: This bug bounty program is focused on finding bugs in the core Bto1 Beacon Chain specification and the Prysm, Lighthouse, and Teku client implementations.
page-open-bug-bountycard-text: Attacker can sometimes put a node in a state that causes it to drop one out of every one hundred attestations made by a validator
page-open-bug-bountycard-text-1: Attacker can successfully conduct eclipse attacks on nodes with peer-ids with 4 leading zero bytes
page-open-bug-bountycard-text-2: There is a consensus bug between two clients, but it is difficult or impractical for the attacker to trigger the event.
page-open-bug-bountycard-text-3: There is a consensus bug between two clients, and it is trivial for an attacker to trigger the event.
